701.01 LICENSE FEES; WHERE DEPOSITED.
   All license fees authorized by ordinance and collected by the City shall be
placed to the credit of the General Fund and otherwise disposed of as provided
by law.
(1979 Code 110.01)
701.02 AUTHORITY IN MAYOR.
   Authority is conferred on, vested in and delegated to the Mayor to grant and
issue licenses provided for by ordinance, and to revoke the same.
(1979 Code 110.02)
CHAPTER 705
Cablevision Franchise Procedures and Standards

CROSS REFERENCES
      Theft of services - see GEN. OFF.
545.19
705.01 SHORT TITLE.
   This chapter shall be known and may be cited as "The Findlay Cablevision
Franchise Procedure and Standards Chapter."
(1979 Code 115.01)
705.02 DEFINITIONS.
   For the purpose of this chapter, the following words and phrases shall have
the following meanings ascribed to them respectively.
   (a)   "Cable television system" (sometimes referred to as a "CATV system" or
"system") means a communications system of coaxial cables or other electrical
conductors, equipment and appurtenances which is capable of receiving,
transmitting and distributing sounds, pictures, writings, data, signals and
other intelligence by electrical impulses, but which is used primarily to
receive television or radio signals directly or indirectly off the air, and
transmit them to subscribers for a fee.
   (b)   "Company" means the cable television franchise applicant selected by
Council as franchisee, as well as the franchisee's successors and assigns.
      (1979 Code 115.02)
705.03 NATURE OF GRANT.
   The City is authorized to select a cable television franchisee who will be
granted the nonexclusive right and privilege to construct, erect, operate and
maintain, in, under, on, along, across, above and over the streets, alleys,
highways, lanes, avenues, sidewalks, bridges, boulevards, public ways or other
public places now laid out or dedicated, and all extensions thereof and
additions thereto, in the City, a cable television system, and grant the right
to use and occupy such streets, alleys and public ways and places to any person
at any time during the period of this franchise.
(1979 Code 115.03)
705.04 AREA SERVICED.
   Any company franchised hereunder shall extend cable television service
throughout the incorporated area of the City at the date of the franchise
grant, in an equitable and reasonable manner so that all parts of the community
are offered the same CATV servicing opportunity. On the annexation of any
territory to the City, the portion of the system that is located or operated
within such territory and on the streets, alleys or public grounds thereof
shall thereafter be subject to all the terms of this chapter as though it were
an extension of the grant made thereunder.
(1979 Code 115.04)
705.05 COMPLIANCE WITH APPLICABLE LAWS AND ORDINANCES.
   The City shall retain the right, at all times during the term of any
franchise granted hereunder, to reasonably exercise its police powers over the
franchisee by means of administrative or legislative action. The company shall
comply with all rules and regulations of all appropriate state and federal
agencies of competent jurisdictions, and particularly those of the Federal
Communications Commission. Any revision or modification adopted by the FCC
which would otherwise not be applicable to an existing franchise agreement made
pursuant to this chapter shall nevertheless automatically be incorporated into
such franchise agreement, and made effective one year after the revisions or
modification is adopted by the FCC.
(1979 Code 115.05)
705.06 LIABILITY.
   Any company franchised hereunder shall, at all times, save the City harmless
from and against any and all damages, claims and demands for injury to person
or property which may be made against the City in any manner growing out of the
installation, construction, maintenance and operation, or any one or any
combination of these, of such system or any equipment of the company, and in
case suit is filed against the City, either independently or jointly with the
company to recover for any claim or damages, such company, on notice to it by
the City, shall defend the City against the action, and, in the event of a
final judgment being obtained against the City, either independently or jointly
with the company on account solely of the acts of the company, the company
shall pay such judgment and all costs, and hold the City harmless therefrom.
(1979 Code 115.06)
705.07 INSURANCE.
   Any company franchised hereunder shall carry insurance to protect the City
and the franchisee from and against all claims, demands, actions, judgments,
costs, expenses and liabilities which may arise or result, directly or
indirectly, from or by reason of, such loss, injury or damage. The amount of
such insurance against liability due to physical damages to property shall not
be less than twenty-five thousand dollars ($25,000) as to any one accident and
not less than two hundred thousand dollars ($200,000) aggregate in any single
policy year; and against liability due to bodily injury or to death of persons,
not less than one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000) as to any one person and
not less than three hundred thousand dollars ($300,000) as to any one accident.
All policies shall be maintained and in effect for the entire life of any
franchise term. Such policy or policies of insurance shall be approved by the
Service-Safety Director of the City and certificates of such insurance, along
with written evidence of payment of required premiums, and shall be filed and
maintained with the Service-Safety Director.
(1979 Code 115.07)
705.08 SERVICE STANDARDS.
   Any company franchised hereunder shall maintain and operate its system and
render efficient service in accordance with the rules and regulations as set
forth by this chapter, any amendments thereto, and the terms of the company's
franchise agreement with the City.
   (a)   Notice of interruption for repairs. Whenever it is necessary to shut
off or interrupt service for the purpose of making repairs, adjustments or
installations, the company shall do so at such time as will cause the least
amount of inconvenience to its customers, and unless such interruption is
unforeseen or immediately necessary, it shall give reasonable notice thereof to
its customers.
   (b)   At the beginning of any original franchise term or renewal term, the
franchisee shall meet as minimum technical standards those standards required
by the FCC of applicants for a new system. If such minimum technical standards
for new systems are changed during the term of the franchise, the franchisee
may be required, on eighteen months' notice, to comply with the new minimum
standards for applicants for new systems, provided that in no event shall such
compliance be required in less than three years after such change. By this, the
City intends that its franchisee will be no more than three years
technologically outdated.
   (c)   The franchisee shall provide no less than the number of signals and
carriages presently being devoted to rebroadcast and relay of TV signals, the
present number being fifteen signals carried over twelve channels.
   (d)   After providing eighteen months' notice, the City may at any time
require a company to furnish additional channel capacity and special channels
for public access, educational and governmental use, but not in excess of the
capacity required by FCC rules and regulations for a community located in one
of the first 100 major television markets as defined by the FCC.
   (e)   A franchisee shall exercise care in the installation and maintenance
of its equipment such that no interference is caused to existing communications
systems, and so as not to distort or interfere with direct off-the-air
television signals.
      (1979 Code 115.08)
705.09 COMPANY RULES.
   (a)   Any company franchised hereunder shall have the authority to
promulgate such rules, regulations, terms and conditions governing the conduct
of its business as shall be reasonably necessary to enable the company to
exercise its rights and perform its obligations under this chapter, and to
assure an uninterrupted service to each and all of its customers. However, such
rules, regulations, term and conditions shall not be in conflict with the
provisions hereof or of laws of the State or any federal law or regulation.
Such rules shall specifically cover delinquency and discontinuance of service.
   (b)   Copies of all such rules, rate schedules and other charges shall be
made available to the public at the company's office in the City.
(1979 Code 115.09)
705.10 CONSTRUCTION AND MAINTENANCE.
   Any company granted a franchise hereunder shall promptly accomplish
significant construction within one year after receiving its certificate of
compliance from the FCC. Construction and maintenance of the transmission
distribution system shall be in accordance with the provisions of the National
Electrical Safety Code of the National Fire Protective Association, and such
applicable ordinances and regulations of the City, affecting electrical
installations, which may be presently in effect, or changed by future
ordinances. All installations of equipment shall be of permanent nature,
durable and installed in accordance with good engineering practice, and of
sufficient height to comply with all existing City regulations, ordinances and
state laws so as not to interfere in any manner with the right of any public or
individual property owner, and shall not interfere with the travel and use of
public places by the public during the construction, repair or removal thereof,
and shall not obstruct or impede traffic.
(1979 Code 115.10)
705.11 SERVICE TO SCHOOLS.
   A company granted a franchise hereunder shall furnish and deliver all
signals carried by the company's system to a designated point outside the
school building but on the property or grounds of any public school within the
City, without charge. All attachment to and distribution of signals within any
school building or buildings shall be done by or at the expense of the school.
The company shall provide similar services without cost to private schools,
including parochial or other religious schools. The franchisee shall also
provide for those channels used by governmental and civic groups, otherwise
required by the rules and regulations of the FCC.
(1979 Code 115.11)
705.12 PERFORMANCE BOND.
   A company granted a franchise hereunder shall furnish a bond to the City in
the amount designated by the franchising authority and in such form and with
such sureties as shall be approved by the Service-Safety Director, guaranteeing
the faithful performance of all of the obligations of the franchisee under the
terms of this chapter, within thirty days after the commencement of this
franchise, if such bond has not already been given.
(1979 Code 115.12)
705.13 PREFERENTIAL AND DISCRIMINATORY PRACTICES PROHIBITED.
   Any company selected hereunder shall not, as to monthly rates, service
facilities, rules, regulations, or in any other respect, make or grant any
preference or advantage to any person, nor subject any person to any prejudice
or disadvantage, provided that nothing in this franchise is deemed to prohibit
the establishment of a graduate scale of charges and classified rate schedules
to which any customer coming within such classification would be entitled, and
provided further that this section shall not prohibit the reduction or
elimination of installation or other one-time charges offered generally to the
public for a limited time to promote and encourage the installation of
additional cablevision connections.
(1979 Code 115.13)
705.14 APPROVAL OF FRANCHISE TRANSFERS.
   Council reserves the right to approve any transfers of the franchisee, in
order to insure uniformity of service and continuity of rate structures. In the
event of an approved franchise transfer, any resultant goodwill or going
business value shall not be recognized by the City as an investment in
subsequent rate review proceedings. Any company selected under the terms of
this chapter shall not sell, lease, assign or otherwise alienate the franchise
grant or any privilege thereunder, without first acquiring the approval of
Council.
(1979 Code 115.14)
705.15 FRANCHISE PROCESS.
   In order to provide for public participation in franchise selection and to
assure fundamentals of due process, the City adopts the following franchise
selection process:
   (a)   Council shall itself serve as the City's franchising authority.
   (b)   Council shall conduct the franchisee selection process herein
described and, after fully considering the evidence presented and the best
interests of the City, select cable television franchisees.
   (c)   Whenever any new system is proposed, or whenever Council determines
that the City is being inadequately serviced with cable television, Council
shall invite applications for a CATV franchise with the City and give adequate
public notice thereof.
   (d)   Whenever an existing franchise expires, a succeeding franchise shall
be designated a renewal franchise, regardless of any changes in the provisions
of the franchise agreement. An existing franchise shall be eligible to apply
for the renewal franchise. Other competing applicants shall also be permitted
to apply for the renewal franchise at the same time and be considered along
with the existing franchisee.
   (e)   Council shall place all franchise applications on public file,
available at reasonable times in the Clerk of Council's office.
   (f)   Council shall give public notice of all such filings, so that the
City's residents may familiarize themselves with the franchise applicants and
intelligently engage in the franchisee selection process.
   (g)   At a reasonable time in advance of any proposed public hearings,
Council shall publicly give adequate notice thereof.
   (h)   At a convenient time and place, Council shall then conduct a public
proceeding, at which all interested persons shall be afforded the opportunity
of testifying as to the qualifications of the various franchise applicants.
   (i)   At such public proceedings, Council shall examine, among other
factors, the applicants' legal character and financial and technical
qualifications, as well as the adequacy and feasibility of their construction
arrangements.
   (j)   Within a reasonable time after the conclusion of such public
proceedings, Council shall review the evidence presented and select a
franchisee.
(1)   In the case of a new franchise, Council shall select that applicant which
is best qualified to meet the needs of the City, and shall make a public report
setting forth the basis for its selection. The selection shall not be based
solely on which applicant offers the lower subscriber rates, but shall take
into account all the characteristics and qualifications of the applicant listed
in subsection (i) hereof and may further take into account the reputation, the
record of performance and the financial results an applicant may have developed
in operating CATV systems in various communities.
(2)   In the case of a renewal of an existing franchise, the existing
franchisee shall be selected over competing applicants if the existing
franchisee:
A.   Demonstrates that he possesses the requisite legal, character, financial
and technical qualifications;
B.   Establishes at the public hearing that during the preceding franchise
term, its record of performance has been satisfactory and its program service
has been substantially attuned to meeting the needs and interest of the area;
and
C.   Satisfies the franchising authority that it will provide at competitive
rates a quality of service and programming substantially equal or better than
that available to the City from other cablevision companies.
   (k)   Finally, Council shall enter into a nonexclusive cable television
franchise agreement, the terms of which shall comply in all substantial regards
with the provisions of this chapter as well as any amendments thereto. Any
individual franchise may include additional terms, not otherwise in conflict
with FCC rules or the express mandates of this chapter.
      (1979 Code 115.15)
705.16 FRANCHISE RECORD AND ACCOUNT KEEPING.
   (a)   Any company selected hereunder as a cable television franchisee shall
maintain a local office within the City to facilitate record keeping, the
payment of subscription charges and the handling of service complaints. The
City reserves the right to examine, and keep copies of, all records and
accounts of the company, and the right to audit, examine and keep copies of
such records and accounts, and to require from the company detailed reports at
any reasonable time relating to the finances and operation of such company. The
company shall regularly file its annual financial statements with the Clerk of
Council within seventy-five days after the end of its annual accounting period.
The company is further required to establish and maintain a separate section of
accounts and record keeping for that portion of its system operative within the
City limits and in contiguous area surrounding the City. The City may require
that the company file separate certified financial statements for the
franchisee's City activities.
   (b)   The company shall at all times keep on file with the Clerk of Council
an up-to-date copy of all pole rental agreements with telephone and electric
power companies.
   (c)   The company shall maintain an accurate and current record of all
service complaints it has received, including its disposition thereof, and
shall retain for inspection by the City all responses received from the annual
customer inquiry conducted pursuant to Section
705.18.
   (d)   The company shall file with the Clerk of Council a copy of any
additional documents or reports which it may judge relevant to the City's
supervision and regulation of the company's activities in the City and any and
all other documents and information as Council may reasonably request.
(1979 Code 115.16)
705.17 MANNER OF GIVING NOTICES.
   Whenever, by the terms of this chapter or any franchise agreement, the City
is required to give notice to the company, such notice shall be given in
writing addressed to the company's designated resident manager and delivered to
the principal office of the company in the City. Whenever the company is
required to give notice to the City, such notice shall be given in writing
addressed to the Clerk of Council and delivered to his office during ordinary
business hours.
(1979 Code 115.17)
705.18 SERVICE COMPLAINT PROCEDURE.
   (a)   Any company selected as a franchisee hereunder shall designate a
representative, who will be available at the company's local office at
reasonable hours, and who will be authorized to answer, and make adjustments in
response to, all service complaints of the public, including quality of service
and equipment malfunctions. If attempts at settling the subscriber-company
dispute fail at the representative level, the complainant may petition Council
for the appointment of a three-member arbitration board. The arbitration board
shall be comprised of one member selected by Council, one member selected by
the franchisee and one member selected by, and mutually agreeable to, the other
two members. The arbitration board thus empaneled shall be authorized to hear
testimony in an orderly and fair manner from both sides of the controversy and
render final judgment thereof. No judgment rendered by the arbitration board
shall be construed as precluding an otherwise actionable controversy in a court
of law of competent jurisdiction.
   (b)   At least annually, the company shall solicit comments from each of its
subscribers regarding local programming, the technical quality of its service,
and other CATV-related topics as Council may request.
(1979 Code 115.18)
705.19 RATE STRUCTURE AND FRANCHISE AGREEMENT STANDARDS.
   Any franchise agreement entered into between the City and the company shall
contain specific provisions which are consistent with the following
requirements:
   (a)   The franchise term shall be of reasonable duration, not in excess of
fifteen years.
   (b)   The franchise fee charged by the City shall be reasonable and not in
excess of three percent (3%) of the franshise's annual gross subscriber
revenues from cable television operation in the community, including all forms
of consideration such as initial lump sum payments.
   (c)   The subscription rate structure shall be fair and equitable to all
classes of service without unreasonable discrimination. Before any subscription
rate structure becomes effective (either the initial rate structure or any
subsequent amendment thereto), it shall first be approved by the franchising
authority after conducting appropriate public proceedings.
   (d)   At the end of the fifth and tenth years of any existing franchise
term, the franchising authority and its franchisee shall review as a matter of
course the existing rate structure, and either approve its continuance or make
such appropriate adjustments as may appear necessary to arriving at a figure
which is reasonable and fair to all parties. The foregoing five-year review
periods shall not be construed to prevent the franchisee from petitioning the
franchising authority for a change of subscription rates on a showing of cause.
      (1979 Code 115.19)
705.20 POLE LINE REGULATIONS.
   Any company selected hereunder shall furnish the City at least annually maps
or prints showing the pole line system in sufficient detail to assure the City
of being currently advised as to the location of the cables of the system. It
shall be the responsibility of the company to keep the City advised of any
material changes and additions, and removals in the system, except for the
individual subscriber's connection wires. Wherever, within the City, other wire
carriers such as telephone and electric utilities are compelled, required or
elect to place the wires underground, the company shall also place its wire
facilities underground. No poles or towers shall be installed by the company on
City streets, alleys or public ways except such poles as may be necessary due
to the fact that the pole spacing of either the electric or telephone utility
makes it impractical to use same. In such an event, the company may set an
intervening additional pole within the normal spacing of the electric or
telephone utility's pole line, providing specific written approval shall first
be obtained from the City Engineer as to actual need. In no event shall the
absence of a pole line agreement be regarded as justification for installing
poles or towers.
(1979 Code 115.20)
705.21 MANNER OF TERMINATION.
   (a)   The City reserves the right to revoke the rights of any franchise
granted hereunder if the company fails, after sixty days' written notice, to
comply with the conditions, provisions or regulations under this chapter or
under the terms of its franchise agreement. The company at any time during the
effective period of this chapter may terminate its agreement hereunder on
giving the City ninety days written notice of such termination, provided the
company pays the City, within thirty days of the effective date of such
termination, all sums due the City under the provisions of its franchise.
   (b)   (1)   On termination for cause as provided by this chapter, the City,
at its election, and on payment to the franchisee of a sum equal to the net
book value of the physical property of the system, shall have the right to
purchase and take over the CATV system in its entirety.
      (2)   On expiration of the term of any franchise granted hereunder, or on
receipt of an application for franchise transfer approval as set forth in
Section
705.14, the City, at its election, and on payment to the franchisee of a sum
equal to the fair market value of the physical property of the system, shall
have the right to purchase and take over the CATV system in its entirety.
      (3)   Under subsections (b)(1) and (2) hereof, any sum payable by the
City for net book value or fair market value shall in no event include and the
franchisee shall not receive anything for the valuation of "good-will" or of
any right or privilege appertaining to it under its franchise. On exercise of
either of these options by the City and its service of an official notice of
such action on the franchisee, and on payment of the purchase price, the
franchisee shall immediately transfer to the City possession and title to all
facilities and property, real and personal, of the CATV business, free from any
and all liens and encumbrances not agreed to be assumed by the City in lieu of
some portion of the purchase price set forth above, and the franchisee shall
execute such warranty deeds or other instruments of conveyance to the City as
shall be necessary for the purpose.
   (c)   In order that the City may exercise its option to take over the
facilities and property of the system as herein provided, the franchisee shall
not make, execute or enter into any deed, deed of trust, mortgage, contract,
conditional sale contract or any loan, lease pledge, sale, gift, pole
agreement, or any other agreement concerning any of its facilities or property,
real or personal, without prior approval of Council.
(1979 Code 115.21)
705.22 SUPERVISION AND INSPECTION.
   The City shall have the right to supervise all construction or installation
work performed subject to the provisions of this chapter and any franchise
granted hereunder, and to make such inspections as it shall find necessary to
insure compliance with the governing ordinances and the terms of the franchise
agreement.
(1979 Code 115.22)
CHAPTER 707
Going-Out-Of-Business Sales
707.01   Definitions.
707.02   License required.
707.03   Application of regulations.
707.04   Application requirements.
707.05   Effect of license.
707.06   Duties of licensee.
707.99   Penalty.
CROSS REFERENCES
      Theft by deception - see GEN. OFF.
545.05
707.01 DEFINITIONS.
   For purposes of this chapter, the following words and phrases shall have the
following meanings ascribed to them respectively.
   (a)   "City License Officer" means the Mayor of the City.
   (b)   "Fire and other altered goods sale" means a sale held out in such a
manner as to reasonably cause the public to believe that the sale will offer
goods damaged or altered by fire, smoke, water or other means.
   (c)   "Going-out-of-business sale" means a sale held out in a manner which
reasonably causes the public to believe that on the disposal of the stock of
goods on hand, the business will cease and be discontinued, including, but not
limited to, the following sales: adjuster's; adjustment; alteration;
assignee's; bankrupt; administrator's; benefit of creditors; building coming
down; closing; creditor's; end; executor's; final days; forced out; forced-out-
of-business; insolvents'; last days; lease expires; liquidations; loss of
lease; mortgage sale; receiver's; trustee's; quitting business.
   (d)   "Goods" includes any goods, wares, merchandise or other property
capable of being the object of a sale regulated hereunder.
   (e)   "Removal of business sale" means a sale held out in such a manner as
to reasonably cause the public to believe that the person conducting the sale
will cease and discontinue business at the place of sale on disposal of the
stock or goods on hand, and will then move to and resume business at a new
location in the City, or will then continue business from other existing
locations in the City.
      (1979 Code 110.15)
707.02 LICENSE REQUIRED.
   A license issued by the City License Officer shall be obtained by any person
before selling or offering to sell any goods at a sale to be advertised or held
out by any means to be one of the following kinds:
   (a)   Going-out-of-business sale;
   (b)   Removal of business sale; and
   (c)   Fire and other altered stock sale.
      (1979 Code 110.16)
707.03 APPLICATION OF REGULATIONS.
   (a)   Provisions Supplement General Law. The provisions of this chapter are
intended to augment the other provisions of the Codified Ordinances of this
City. Where this chapter imposes a greater restriction on persons, premises,
businesses or practices than is imposed by the Codified Ordinances of this
City, this chapter shall control.
   (b)   Established Business Requisite. Any person who has not been the owner
of a business advertised or described in the application for a license
hereunder for a period of at least six months prior to the date of the proposed
sale shall not be granted a license. An exception is made for survivors of
businessmen. On the death of a person doing business in the City, his heirs,
devisees or legatees shall have the right to apply at any time for a license
hereunder.
   (c)   Interval Between Sales. Any person who has held a sale, as regulated
hereunder, at the location stated in the application, within one year last past
from the date of such application, shall not be granted a license.
   (d)   Restricted Location. Where a person applying for a license hereunder
operates more than one place of business, the license issued shall apply only
to the one store or branch specified in the application, and no other store or
branch shall advertise or represent that it is cooperating with it, or in any
way participating in the licensed sale, nor shall the store or branch
conducting the licensed sale advertise or represent that any other store or
branch is cooperating with it or participating in any way in the licensed sale.
   (e)   Persons Exempted. The provisions of this chapter shall not apply to or
affect the following persons:
(1)   Persons acting pursuant to an order or process of a court of competent
jurisdiction;
(2)   Persons acting in accordance with their powers and duties as public
officials;
(3)   Duly licensed auctioneers, selling at auction;
(4)   Persons conducting a sale of the type regulated herein on the effective
date of this chapter, unless such sale is continued for a period of more than
ten days from and after such effective date, in which event, such person, at
the lapse of the ten-day period, shall comply with the provisions of this
chapter;
(5)   Any publisher of a newspaper, magazine or other publication, who
publishes in good faith any advertisement, without knowledge of its false,
deceptive or misleading character, or without knowledge that the provisions of
this chapter have not been complied with.
         (1979 Code 110.17)
707.04 APPLICATION REQUIREMENTS.
   (a)   Written Information Required. A person desiring to conduct a sale
regulated by this chapter shall make a written application to the License
Officer setting forth and containing the following information:
(1)   The true name and address of the owner of the goods to be the object of
the sale;
(2)   The true name and address of the person from whom he purchased the goods
to be sold and the price therefor, and if not purchased, the manner of such
acquisition;
(3)   A description, with the address, of the place where such sale is to be
held;
(4)   The nature of the occupancy, whether by lease or sublease, and the
effective date of termination of such occupancy;
(5)   The dates of the period of time in which the sale is to be conducted;
(6)   A full and complete statement of the facts in regard to the sale,
including the reason for the urgent and expeditious disposal of goods thereby
and the manner in which the sale will be conducted;
(7)   The means to be employed in advertising such sale;
(8)   A complete and detailed inventory of the goods to be sold at such sale as
disclosed by the applicant's records. Such inventory shall be attached to and
become part of the required application, and the City Licensing Officer is
authorized to appoint not more than two responsible residents of the City, who
may or may not be engaged in the same or similar business as the applicant, to
become inventory inspectors for the purpose of determining the correctness of
the inventory filed by the applicant. The applicant, his agent or employees
shall permit such inspecting officer or officers complete access to a copy of
their inventory fixed with their application, and to their complete inventory
of merchandise and goods at any reasonable time. The applicant, his agent or
employees shall cooperate fully with such inspector or inspectors in the
furtherance of their duties required hereunder. The inspectors shall inspect
the inventory of the applicant from time to time during the course of any sale
conducted in compliance with this chapter to determine whether additional
merchandise or goods are being added to the original inventory as filed.
A.   Bona fide orders. All goods included in such inventory shall have been
purchased by the applicant for resale on bona fide orders without cancellation
privileges, and shall not comprise goods purchased on consignment.
B.   Goods purchased for sale hereunder. Such inventory shall not include goods
ordered in contemplation of conducting a sale regulated hereunder. Any unusual
purchase, or addition to the stock of goods of the business effected within
sixty days before the filing of an application hereunder, shall be deemed to be
of such character.
   (b)   License Fee. Any applicant for a license hereunder shall submit to the
License Officer with his application a license fee of five dollars ($5.00). Any
applicant for a renewal license hereunder shall submit to the License Officer
with his renewal application a renewal license fee of five dollars ($5.00).
(1979 Code 110.18)
707.05 EFFECT OF LICENSE.
   A license shall be issued hereunder on the following terms:
   (a)   Licensing Period. The license shall authorize the sale described in
the application for a period of not more than twenty-five consecutive days,
Sundays and legal holidays excluded, following the issuance thereof.
   (b)   Renewal Procedure. The License Officer shall renew a license for one
period of time only, such period to be in addition to the twenty-five days
permitted in the original license and not to exceed fifty consecutive days,
Sundays and holidays excluded, when he finds:
(1)   Facts exist justifying the license renewal;
(2)   The licensee has filed an application for renewal;
(3)   The licensee has submitted with the application for renewal a revised
inventory showing the items listed on the original inventory remaining unsold,
and not listing any goods not included in the original application and
inventory;
(4)   For the purposes of this subdivision, any application for a license under
the provisions of this chapter covering any goods previously inventoried as
required hereunder shall be deemed to be an application for renewal, whether
presented by the original applicant, or by any other person.
   (c)   Nature of Sale. The license shall authorize only one type of sale
described in the application at the location named therein.
   (d)   Saleable Goods. The license shall authorize only the sale of goods
described in the inventory attached to the application.
   (e)   Surrender of General License. On being issued a license hereunder for
a going-out-of-business sale, the licensee shall surrender to the License
Officer all other business licenses he may hold at the time applicable to the
location and goods covered by the application for a license under this chapter.
   (f)   Nontransferability. Any license herein provided for shall not be
assignable or transferable.
      (1979 Code 110.19)
707.06 DUTIES OF LICENSEE.
   A licensee hereunder shall:
   (a)   Adhere to Inventory. Make no additions whatsoever during the period of
the licensed sale to the stock of goods set forth in the inventory attached to
the application for license.
   (b)   Advertise Properly. Refrain from employing any untrue, deceptive or
misleading advertising.
   (c)   Adhere to Advertising. Conduct the licensed sale in strict conformity
with any advertising or holding out incident thereto.
   (d)   Keep Duplicate Inventory. Keep available at the place of sale a
duplicate copy of the inventory submitted with the application, and shall
present such duplicate to inspecting officials on request.
   (e)   Segregate Noninventoried Goods. Keep any other goods separate and
apart from the goods listed in the filed inventory as being objects of sale,
and shall make such distinction clear to the public by placing tags on all
inventoried goods in and about the place of sale apprising the public of the
status of all such goods.
      (1979 Code 110.20)
707.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter is guilty of a misdemeanor of
the first degree.
CHAPTER 711
Handbills and Billposting
711.01   Bill posting and sign writing license; restrictions.
711.02   Distributing handbills and samples; license; restrictions.
711.03   Card tacking license; restrictions.
711.04   Definitions; general license regulations.
711.05   Fees.
711.06   Exceptions to license requirement.
711.07   Revocation of license.
711.08   Placement of signs on City property.
711.99   Penalty.
CROSS REFERENCES
         Littering - see GEN. OFF.
521.03
         Damage to property - see GEN. OFF.
541.04
711.01 BILL POSTING AND SIGN WRITING LICENSE; RESTRICTIONS.
   No person shall engage in the business of bill posting, advertising or sign
writing, or post or paint on any billboards, walls, pavements, fences or other
places in the City any bills or other advertising matter without obtaining a
license as hereinafter provided. Any licensee may employ others to help him,
but if he does so, he shall furnish such employees with certificates or badges
showing for whom they are working, and these employees shall display the
certificates or badges at all times. The licensee shall not, either through
himself or employees, display, post or paint, or permit to be displayed, posted
or painted, any improper bill or advertisement; nor shall he post or display
any bills or advertisements in or on any of the streets or other public places
of the City; nor shall he post or allow to be posted any bills or paint or
allow to be painted any bills, advertising or signs on any billboard or
structure maintained in violation of any provision of this Code.
(1979 Code 110.05)
711.02 DISTRIBUTING HANDBILLS AND SAMPLES; LICENSE; RESTRICTIONS.
   No person shall engage in the business of distributing handbills, circulars,
cards or samples of goods, notices, posters or any other kinds of advertising
matter or schemes to pedestrians on the streets or other public places in the
City, or go from place to place about the City, on the streets or other public
places distributing such advertising matter or schemes at dwelling houses,
shops, places of business or entertainment, or on motor vehicles, without
having obtained a license. Such person may employ others to assist him, but if
he does so, he shall furnish each such employee with a certificate or badge
showing for whom he is working, and such employee shall display such
certificate or badge at all times. No such licensee, through himself or
employees, nor any person shall scatter any advertising matter, samples or
other advertising schemes, in or on the streets or other public places of the
City. He shall not distribute any indecent or improper advertising matter or
scheme. He shall not throw or scatter such advertising matter, sample or scheme
in the dooryards or on the lawns, or on or in any of the streets or other
places in the City, or post or hang the same on any pole, post, tree or other
structure in or on any street or other public place.
(1979 Code 110.06)
711.03 CARD TACKING LICENSE; RESTRICTIONS.
   No person shall tack or hang on any wall, building, fence or other place in
the City, any card, bill, poster or other advertising matter without obtaining
a license. Such person may employ others to assist him, but if he does so, he
shall furnish each such employee with a certificate or badge showing for whom
he is working, and such employee shall display such certificate or badge at all
times. No person shall tack or hang any card, bill, poster or other advertising
matter on any wall, building, fence or other place in the City without
obtaining the consent in writing of the owner or occupant of the real estate on
which such wall, building, fence or other place in the City is located. No
person shall tack or hang any card, bill, poster or other advertising matter on
any utility pole, post or other structure located in or on any street, alley,
public way or other public place.
(1979 Code 110.07)
711.04 DEFINITIONS; GENERAL LICENSE REGULATIONS.
   In construing the provisions of this chapter, "person" includes any
individual, firm or corporation; the masculine gender includes the feminine and
the neuter gender; the granting of a license shall not warrant or protect the
licensee in the violation of any proper rule of any officer, department or
board of the City, or ordinance or law of the State. For the purpose of this
chapter, the act of the employee of the licensee shall be considered the act of
the licensee. No license granted under this chapter shall in any manner be
transferred; the licensee shall at all times on the request of any officers of
the City, or any person directly interested, exhibit his license. All licenses
in force at the time this chapter was passed shall be valid until, by the terms
thereof, they expire. The Mayor shall issue to all licensees a written or
printed certificate or license giving the date when issued, and when it
expires, the name of the licensee, and the purpose for which the license is
issued, and shall keep a record of the same in his office. All applications for
licenses shall be in writing, and shall be under oath when required by the
Mayor, and shall be made to the Mayor, who, when the applicant has complied
with the provisions of this chapter, and has paid the necessary fee, shall
issue licenses as herein provided.
(1979 Code 110.08)
711.05 FEES.
   The fee to be paid for the several licenses herein provided for shall be as
follows:
   (a)   Bill Posting and Sign Writing. Twenty-five dollars ($25.00) per year,
or if the license is issued for a shorter period than one year, ten dollars
($10.00) per day.
   (b)   Bill Distributing. Twenty-five dollars ($25.00) per year, or if the
license is issued for a shorter period than one year, ten dollars ($10.00) per
day.
   (c)   Card Tacking. Twenty-five dollars ($25.00) per year, or if the license
is issued for a shorter period than one year, ten dollars ($10.00) per day.
      (1979 Code 110.09)
711.06 EXCEPTIONS TO LICENSE REQUIREMENT.
   Nothing in this chapter shall be construed to require the payment of a
license fee by merchants doing business in the City for advertising their own
business; nor shall it apply to advertising matter of any article or compound
which has been manufactured or compounded within the City. No bona fide
political, religious or union organization shall be required to secure or pay
for a license as outlined in this chapter.
(1979 Code 110.10)
711.07 REVOCATION OF LICENSE.
   In addition to any penalties otherwise provided, the Mayor, upon being
satisfied that the licensee has violated any of the provisions of this chapter
or any other provision of this Code, or any proper rule of any department or
office of the City, or law of the State relating to the particulars for which
the license is issued, shall revoke the license or suspend the same for such
time as he may deem proper. The revocation of a license or suspension of the
same shall not entitle the licensee to the return of any part of the fee paid
by him.
(1979 Code 110.11)
711.08 PLACEMENT OF SIGNS ON CITY PROPERTY.
   (a)   Placement of all signs, regardless of size or design, shall be
prohibited on all City-owned property, including street rights of way,
boulevards and thoroughfares within the City.
   (b)   All governmental agencies are specifically excepted from this section.
(1979 Code 110.12)
711.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter is guilty of a minor
misdemeanor. Each piece of advertising posted in violation of this chapter
shall be considered a separate offense.
CHAPTER 715
Home Sales
715.01   Definition.
715.02   Intent.
715.03   Prohibitions.
715.99   Penalty.
CROSS REFERENCES
      Theft by deception - see GEN. OFF.
545.05
715.01 DEFINITION.
   "Home sales" means a sale of personal property to the general public
conducted on any portion of the residence property within residentially zoned
districts, to include but not to be limited to, garage sales, patio sales, yard
sales, carport sales, basement sales, porch sales, driveway sales and the like.
(1979 Code 116.70)
715.02 INTENT.
   It is the intent to regulate, restrict and control home sales conducted on
residence premises within residentially zoned districts. It is not the intent
to prevent corporations not for profit, churches, temples or recognized
fraternities, sororities, clubs or lodges from conducting home sales, provided,
such corporations not for profit, churches, temples, recognized fraternities,
sororities, clubs or lodges, conduct their sales on real estate owned and/or
occupied by such organization.
   It is further not the intent to prohibit sales conducted by nonconforming
businesses located in residentially zoned districts.
(1979 Code 116.71)
715.03 PROHIBITIONS.
   (a)   No home sale shall be conducted by the same resident or member of his
or her family and/or on the same residential property more than twice in a
calendar year.
   (b)   No home sale shall be conducted during hours other than between 8:00
a.m. and 8:00 p.m. and in no event shall a home sale last more than three
consecutive days.
   (c)   No home sale shall offer any merchandise for sale that has been
purchased by the resident for purposes of resale at such home sale. Any new
merchandise offered for sale shall be prima facie evidence as merchandise
purchased by the resident for resale at such home sale.
   (d)   Home sales may be advertised through the newspaper or other news
media.
(1)   A sign, not greater in size than three feet by three feet, may be
installed on the property where the sale is being conducted.
(2)   No sign shall be placed on the public right of way or on property other
than where the sale is being conducted. No lighted sign shall be used.
(3)   The sign shall be displayed only during the sale and shall be promptly
removed after the sale.
   (e)   Prior to and during the conduct of a home sale, as permitted, no
person shall place or display any of such property in front of the building
setback line and no person shall place or permit any signs advertising,
promoting or giving directions to the sale, at any location other than the
property on which the sale is being conducted.
   (f)   No more than two home sales per year may be held at such residence.
(1979 Code 116.72)
715.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates Section
715.03 is guilty of a minor misdemeanor for a first offense, fifty dollars
($50.00), and is guilty of a misdemeanor of the fourth degree for a second or
subsequent offense. Each day's violation shall constitute a separate offense.
CHAPTER 753
Junk and Secondhand Dealers
753.01   Definition.
753.02   Junkyards in operation; fence required.
753.03   Requirements for new junkyards.
753.04   Junkyard license; application; fee.
753.05   Clean and sanitary condition.
753.99   Penalty.
CROSS REFERENCES
      Power to regulate - see Ohio R.C. 715.61
      Secondhand dealers - see Ohio R.C. Ch. 4737
      Record of transactions required - see Ohio R.C. 4737.01, 4737.04
      Dealing with minors prohibited; hours regulated - see Ohio R.C. 4737.03
      Junk yards - see Ohio R.C. 4737.05 et seq.
      Junk yards permitted in I-2 District - see P. & Z.
1165.02
753.01 DEFINITION.
   For purposes of Sections 753.01 to 753.05, "junkyard" means an enclosed or
unenclosed, and roofed or unroofed area or yard now or hereafter created, used
or occupied as such, on which is stored or kept for sale as a principal
business, scrap metals, rope, paper, rags, used automobile parts, wrecked
automobiles or automobiles unfit for further use as such, or other refuse or
waste materials.
(1979 Code 112.10)
753.02 JUNKYARDS IN OPERATION; FENCE REQUIRED.
   No junkyard shall be operated or maintained adjacent to any improved public
street or avenue of the City, or adjacent to any dwelling house occupied as
such, until there is constructed and maintained a building or a tight board
fence not less than eight feet in height, or other approved fence, between such
street or avenue or such dwelling house, and that portion of the yard on which
junk and refuse is stored or kept.
753.03 REQUIREMENTS FOR NEW JUNKYARDS.
   (a)   No junkyard shall be created or erected within 100 feet of any street
or avenue in the City or within 200 feet of any dwelling occupied as such
without obtaining the written consent of the owner of such dwelling. In the
event such written consent is obtained, there shall be constructed and
maintained a building or a tight board fence not less than eight feet high
between the property line of such consenting owner and the space in the open
area of which junk and refuse is stored or proposed to be stored.
   (b)   The building or fence as provided in this section and in Section
753.02 shall be kept in good repair, and shall be painted and kept painted in
accordance with regulations of the Service-Safety Director of the City.
(1979 Code 112.12)
753.04 JUNKYARD LICENSE; APPLICATION; FEE.
   (a)   No junkyard shall be erected, created, maintained or operated in the
City without having obtained a license from the Mayor.
   (b)   Each applicant for such license shall file with the Mayor a statement,
verified by oath, giving the location of his place of business, the area in
square feet to be occupied by the business, and the nature of the business,
including a statement that he intends to comply with all the requirements of
Sections 753.01 to 753.05 and shall annually thereafter, thirty days preceding
the expiration of his license, file a like statement verified by oath.
   (c)   The fee to be paid annually for such license shall be twelve dollars
and fifty cents ($12.50) for the first 10,000 square feet and fifteen dollars
($15.00) for each additional 10,000 square feet, or fraction thereof. All
licenses shall be valid for one year from the date of issuance, and shall not
be renewed until the annual statement required herein has been made, and it has
been shown to the satisfaction of the Mayor that the applicant has complied
with all of the regulations and stipulations contained in Sections 753.01 to
753.05.
(1979 Code 112.13)
753.05 CLEAN AND SANITARY CONDITION.
   All junkyards operated and maintained in the City shall be kept in a clean
and sanitary condition, and shall be subject at all times to the supervision
and orders of the Service-Safety Director and Board of Health, and smoke or
offensive odors shall not be permitted or allowed to escape in such manner or
in such quantities as to cause or have a natural tendency to cause injury,
detriment or annoyance to any person or to the public, or to endanger the
comfort, repose, health or safety of any person or the public, or in such
manner as to cause or have the natural tendency to cause injury or detriment to
business or property.
(1979 Code 112.14)
753.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter is guilty of a misdemeanor of
the third degree. Each day's violation shall constitute a separate offense.
